Package com.example.goldencarrot.data.db

Class UserRepository

java.lang.Object
com.example.goldencarrot.data.db.UserRepository
public class UserRepository extends Object
Provides necessary methods to update, delete, and write User model objects into Firebase User table. The User Id will be the same as the device ID. Please see Firebase for more details on the document structure.

    Modifier and Type
    Class
    Description
    static interface 
    UserRepository.FirestoreCallbackAllUsers
    Callback interface to handle Firestore query results for users collection.
    static interface 
    UserRepository.FirestoreCallbackSingleUser
    Callback interface for querying for a single user.
    static interface 
    UserRepository.UserTypeCallback
    Callback interface to handle the result of the existence check and userType retrieval.

      public UserRepository(com.google.firebase.firestore.FirebaseFirestore firestore)

  • Method Details

    • addUser

      public void addUser(User user, String androidId)
      Adds a new User to Firebase users table. Provides onSuccess and onFailure listeners to handle the result of the operation.
      Parameters:
      user - model object to add.

    • checkUserExistsAndGetUserType

      public void checkUserExistsAndGetUserType(String androidId, UserRepository.UserTypeCallback callback)
      Checks if a user exists in Firestore using the Android ID as the document ID, and retrieves the userType if the user exists.
      Parameters:
      androidId - The Android ID to be used as the document ID.
      callback - A callback to handle the result of the operation.

    • updateUser

      public void updateUser(User user, String androidId)
      Updates an existing user in Firestore using the Android ID as the document ID.
      Parameters:
      user - The User object containing the updated user information.
      androidId - The Android ID used as the document ID.

    • updateUserWithAdditionalData

      public void updateUserWithAdditionalData(String androidId, Map<String,Object> additionalData)
      Updates additional fields for a user in Firestore using the Android ID as the document ID.
      Parameters:
      androidId - The Android ID used as the document ID.
      additionalData - The additional data to update.

    • deleteUser

      public void deleteUser(String androidId)
      Deletes a user from Firestore using the Android ID as the document ID.
      Parameters:
      androidId - The Android device ID used as the document ID to delete.

    • getAllUsersFromFirestore

      public void getAllUsersFromFirestore(UserRepository.FirestoreCallbackAllUsers callback)
      Retrieves all users from the Firestore user collection.
      Parameters:
      callback - handles the result of the query.

    • getSingleUser

      public void getSingleUser(String androidId, UserRepository.FirestoreCallbackSingleUser callback)
      Queries a user from Firestore by their Android ID.
      Parameters:
      androidId - the device ID of the user, assumed to be unique.
      callback - handles the result of the query.

    • addUserWithLocation

      public void addUserWithLocation(Map<String,Object> userData, String androidId, Runnable onSuccess)
